did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: HAWK Papers

physdesc.label: Alternate Extent Statement
physdesc.extent: 1 box; 1 oversized poster; 99 digital files (4.2 GB)

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

did.abstract: This collection includes materials pertaining to the life and rap career of John Edward Hawkins, or HAWK. Digital files comprise the bulk of the collection and mostly include digital photographs of HAWK and his associates at hip hop related events.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information:
bioghist.p: HAWK, also known as H.A.W.K. or Big Hawk, was born John Edward Hawkins in Houston on November 15, 1969. Both HAWK and his brother Patrick Lamark Hawkins, known as Fat Pat, became members of the Screwed Up Click, a group of Houston area rappers centered around the work of DJ Screw. HAWK often worked with DJ Screw to contribute raps to DJ Screw’s famous gray tapes, and he collaborated with Fat Pat, DJ Screw, and others to form the group Dead End Alliance (D.E.A) and Dead End Records.
HAWK released his first solo album, Under H.A.W.K.’s Wings, with Dead End Records in 2000. In 2002, he released his second album, HAWK.
On April 9, 2006, HAWK married his longtime girlfriend, Meshah Hawkins. Shortly thereafter, in May 2006, HAWK was shot and killed. His murder is unsolved.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use:
userestrict.p: Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, but copyright normally belongs to the creator of the materials or their heirs. The researcher has full responsibility for determining copyright status, locating copyright holders, and abiding by current copyright laws when publishing or displaying copies of Special Collections material in print or electronic form. For more information, consult the appropriate librarian.
Reproduction decisions will be made by Special Collections staff on a case-by-case basis. Patrons are responsible for obtaining permission to publish from copyright holders.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: HAWK Papers. Courtesy of Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Information of acquisition method not available.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials:
relatedmaterial.p: DJ Screw Photographs and Memorabilia digital collection (http://digital.lib.uh.edu/collection/djscrew)
HAWK Photographs and Memorabilia digital collection (http://digital.lib.uh.edu/collection/hawk)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes materials pertaining to the life and rap career of John Edward Hawkins, or HAWK. Digital files comprise the bulk of the collection and mostly include digital photographs of HAWK and his associates at hip hop related events. The digital files also include personal family photographs of HAWK’s wedding and funeral, as well as scans of newspaper clippings pertaining to his death. All digital files were scanned from originals owned by HAWK’s family.

The collection also contains a smaller amount of physical material, including a notebook used by HAWK to record rap lyrics and his daily activities, promotional material, and the obituaries, or memorial service programs, for HAWK and his brother Fat Pat.

did.unittitle: Notebook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The notebook includes rap lyrics and information documenting HAWK’s daily life. The original item is fragile and use of the digital surrogate is preferred; please see http://digital.lib.uh.edu/collection/hawk/item/189

did.unittitle: Digital Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The digital files can be accessed in the Special Collections Reading Room. Please note that the filename for each digital file is indicated in the inventory. A spreadsheet with original file name information is available by contacting the curator at jgrob@uh.edu.
